oai_dc:dc.dc:title: On the k-coverage of line segments by a non Homogeneous Poisson-Boolean model
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: ADITYA, ST
MANOHAR, P
MANJUNATH, D
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We consider k-coverage of a tine by a two-dimensional, non homogeneous Poisson-Boolean model. This has applications in sensor networks. We extend the analysis of ill to the case for k > 1. The extension requires us to define a vector Markov process that tracks the k segments that have the longest residual coverage at a point. This process is used to determine the probability of a segment of the line being completely covered by k or more sensors. We illustrate the extension by considering the case of k = 2.
